<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module8_mcq_q81')" data-correct-answer="B">
<strong style="display: block;">A firm has perpetual debt of $300 million at 5% interest. If the corporate tax rate falls from 35% to 25%, by how much does the value of the interest tax shield change?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q81" value="A"> A. $7.5 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q81" value="B"> B. $30 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q81" value="C"> C. $45 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q81" value="D"> D. $75 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q81" value="E"> E. $105 million</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module8_mcq_q81" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: B.  
Under MM with taxes, PV(Tax Shield) = T<sub>C</sub> × D.  
Before = 0.35 × 300 = 105 million  
After = 0.25 × 300 = 75 million  
Change = 105 − 75 = **$30 million** decrease.
</div>

:::
